title: Nandanam
text:
Nandanam is a neighborhood in <a href="Chennai">Chennai</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is a busy location and is home to many commercial institutions. This locality also offers a calm residential location. Nandanam Arts College was established in 1901. Nandanam junction, on the arterial road <a href="Anna%20Salai">Anna Salai</a>, (commonly referred as "Nandanam signal") is one of the busiest junctions in Chennai.
History.
Nandanam seems to have originated in the piece of land known as "Gambier's Gardens" named after Chief Justice John Gambier who owned the property from 1836 to 1850. The township got its name in the 1950s as a result of the housing development efforts instituted during the Chief Ministership of <a href="Rajagopalachari">Rajagopalachari</a> which concentrated on developing a green <a href="Chennai">Chennai</a>.
Transportation.
Buses.
Nandanam has some <a href="Metropolitan%20Transport%20Corporation%20%28Chennai%29">MTC</a> bus stops located on Anna Salai. Many buses pass through this area and offers excellent connectivity to various places.
Railway Station.
The nearest suburban railway stations are <a href="Mambalam%20railway%20station">Mambalam</a> and <a href="Saidapet%20railway%20station">Saidapet</a>.
Metro Rail.
Nandanam has <a href="Chennai%20Metro">metro</a> station called <a href="Nandanam%20metro%20station">Nandanam metro station</a>.
